text: Pitcairnia pavonii is a species of plant in the family Bromeliaceae. It is endemic to Ecuador. Its natural habitats are subtropical or tropical moist montane forests, subtropical or tropical dry shrubland, and subtropical or tropical high-altitude shrubland. It is threatened by habitat loss. ==References== Category:Flora of Ecuador pavonii Category:Near threatened plants Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot Category:Plants described in 1896
title: Pitcairnia pavonii
